small.ui:msg: Help us add information to the artworks of the Rijksmuseum Amsterdam.

div.div: About Accurator Accurator is a platform that allows users to help museum professionals with describing collection items of the Rijksmuseum Amsterdam with expert knowledge. This could, for example, be the annotation of the depicted species of an animal or plant. Apart from contributing to very detailed descriptions, this information can also be used to facilitate searching the museum's collection.

SEALINCMedia Accurator is designed as part of the SEALINCMedia project. The collaborating institutions are VU University Amsterdam, TU University Delft, Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam and the National Library of The Netherlands.

Accurator for research The research challenges of the project are to identify the niche of relevant experts and to motivate them to contribute to the annotation of artworks; developping the personalization mechanisms to make sure that the experts are shown items that correspond to their expertise; evaluating the quality of the annotations and annotators using trust algorithms and to present all these aspects in an appropriate interface. To test our hypotheses, we continuously develop and evaluate Accurator.
COMMIT/ SEALINCMedia is part of the COMMIT/ project which brings together academic research and (non-)profit organizations to solve challenges in ICT.
